title: Fix mobile number validation to accept 10-digit Indian format

requirements.summary: Update mobile number validation in AdmissionFormPage.tsx to accept exactly 10-digit Indian mobile numbers with Hindi error messages
acceptanceCriteria: Entering a 10-digit Indian number like 9450956184 passes validation and does not show an error
Entering fewer or more than 10 digits shows the Hindi error message 'कृपया 10 अंकों का वैध मोबाइल नंबर दर्ज करें'
Leaving the mobile number field empty shows a required/mandatory error
The example hint in the error message shows an Indian format number (e.g., 9450956184), not a Pakistani format number
Form submits successfully when a valid 10-digit number is entered

file_operations.description: Update the mobile number validation logic to accept exactly 10 digits (Indian format). Replace the current validation pattern that enforces Pakistani format (11 digits starting with 03) with a pattern that validates exactly 10 digits (digits only, no leading zero required). Update the error message to read 'कृपया 10 अंकों का वैध मोबाइल नंबर दर्ज करें (जैसे: 9450956184)'. Remove any references to Pakistani format (03001234567) from validation logic and error messages. Ensure the field remains mandatory and that the validation triggers on blur and on form submission.
